intro: Humboltia foetens, commonly known as the stinking nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshades like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in the evening. Its leaves are ovate and often have a slightly serrated edge. The plant is known for its strong, unpleasant odor, which is most noticeable when the flowers open at night.
